translation1: "All Bosch-electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools are carefully inspected, tested, and subjected to strict controls by the Bosch quality assurance. Bosch therefore provides a guarantee for Bosch-electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools. The customer's warranty claims resulting from the purchase contract with the seller, as well as legal rights, are not restricted by this guarantee.For these tools, we provide warranty according to the following conditions: We provide warranty according to the following regulations (No. 2-7) by free repair of defects in the tool that are demonstrably due to material or manufacturing errors within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months, for commercial or professional use or equivalent use 12 months.The warranty period begins with the purchase by the original buyer. The decisive date is the one on the original purchase receipt. For all industrial, blue electric and measuring tools (with the exception of high-frequency tools, industrial battery-powered screwdrivers, and pneumatic tools) purchased after September 1, 2004, the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the buyer registers these tools within 4 weeks after the purchase date.Battery packs and chargers, as well as accessories included, are excluded from this warranty extension. Registration can only be done online at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). As proof, the registration confirmation, which must be printed immediately, and the original purchase receipt, from which the date of purchase can be derived, are valid.A registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of his/her personal data. Excluded from the guarantee are: parts that are subject to wear and tear due to normal use or other natural causes, as well as defects in the tool that are caused by normal use or other natural causes, anomalous environmental conditions, abnormal operating conditions, overloading, or insufficient maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of non-Bosch accessory, auxiliary or replacement parts are also excluded from the guarantee.Tools that have undergone changes or additions. Minor deviations from the standard condition that are insignificant for the value and usability of the tool. The defect is remedied in the way that we repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a flawless tool (possibly also with a subsequent model).Replacement tools or parts become our property."
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent, with no grammatical errors, unnatural wording, or stiff syntax. translation1: "Is tire choice when cycling really as safe as advertised? This morning, I woke up full of determination, wanting to at least train a little for my upcoming cycling tour next week. Well, I did it and I rode my racing bike, which I bought on eBay yesterday.The first 40km were really nice - but then what always lurks in every city center (this time: thank you Krefeld!) happened. Glass splinters on the route. Zack, loud hissing and my rear tire didn't want to continue the rest of the route on no account.Because of the day of the week, I didn't have a real opportunity to get a spare jacket and spare tube, so I had to turn around with somewhat bad mood and take the first train home. It wasn't technically that bad, maybe it's better if I practice the tire change before the bike ride again. But now I'm facing a question and hoping that you can help me.Since I have a relatively long distance to cover over several days, I would be very unhappy to encounter this problem frequently. Now it wasn't really bad, as the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who had 140km on them when I picked up the bike at 10:12 am!) were already considered suboptimal, as he had been riding on them for several years. However, when I think about having to change a tire after 80-90km of riding, I think I'll be in a pretty bad mood: :DNow I have come into conversation with an older man at the platform about why I don't have the Marathon Plus tires; these are supposed to be unrepairable. Of course, that all sounds very tempting. But are they really that indestructible?I have little desire to spend 40€/tire right now, only to be disappointed. Furthermore, I ask myself: when I was on the racing bike, I believed I had 25x622. Although it is also available (apparently) at the Marathon Plus tires, the majority is already wider.Is this a problem? Or would you generally recommend other tires to me for a racing bike? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute favorite! I have more knowledge about the Durano DD.  Translation:  Is this a problem? Or would you generally recommend other tires to me for a racing bike? The Schwalbe side seems to be my absolute favorite! I have more knowledge about the Durano DD.Thank you very much in advance for the help and lovely greetings!"

translation1: "\"Party, that we wanted to spit on\": Frankfurt celebrates after a thrilling comeback against Leverkusen. What a spectacular reaction from Eintracht Frankfurt. After 22 minutes, the last twice champions of Germany seemed to be on their way to the next Bundesliga relegation.But then the SGE turned around, shot itself within an hour of frustration over a disappointing start of the season and won fiercely with 5:2. \"It's crazy what the guys have accomplished today,\" coach Oliver Glasner celebrated with DAZN and praised \"a collective effort, to everyone who was involved.\" It initially looked like another setback for the still ninth-placed Frankfurt. Patrik Schick had put Leverkusen in the lead with 2:0.What happened then also impressed the SGE coach. \"As the players returned and showed a fantastic performance,\" Glasner continued. I am crazy happy with the performance we showed and of course with the result.Even defensive player Christopher Lenz, who was able to return to the field for the first time since the fourth game and overcome his muscle injury, emphasized the morale of his teammates. \"I think our mentality is incredible,\" said the 27-year-old and particularly enjoyed the result for the spectators. That was the party we wanted to throw today.For the upcoming tasks, Glasner wants to keep the focus on himself, but sees himself well positioned in terms of the personnel situation. It is extraordinary that all players are fit in December and all players are physically in top condition. It is top work in our medical department, but the players also live highly professionally.Now we want to \"move forward step by step and stay humble\" and complete the tasks until the end of the year \"at this level\". Next up is already on Wednesday as part of the English week, an away game at Borussia Mönchengladbach (7:30 PM, Sky)."

translation1: "Problems with Glass Fiber + Devolo DLAN/Magic  We have had a new glass fiber connection in the house for a few weeks now. However, at the other DLan module, which sends WiFi, not the full 500 Mbit comes anymore, but the further I move away from the module with a power strip (which is placed 1, 2, 3, etc. rooms away from the other module), the less comes in (so use a power strip that is placed 1, 2, 3, etc. rooms away from the other module).This leads to the fact that the Internet with the new fiber optic connection is now even slower on the first floor (~45 Mbit) than before. I have also ordered a new Devolo Magic Set, which apparently uses a new technology. This was slightly better than DLan, but here too there were similar losses.Could someone explain to me why so much internet speed is lost over the power line using fiber optics? translation1: "Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, leading to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the \"Valve Reactor\" circuitry, which perfectly imitates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amplifiers, we are presenting a brand new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET (Virtual Element Technology) technology, which is based on the analysis of components and amplifier circuits, the VTX amplifiers wait with an authenticity that is absolutely impressive.Of course, these amps also feature the multi-stage Valvetronix tube preamplifier. This design partly relies on genuine analog circuits because these can better capture the sound variations and nuances of a tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, VTX amplifiers offer a closed housing and a bass reflex system, from which the natural resonances just flow.With the \"Tone Room\" software from VOX, you can even correct and bend historical facts on the virtual level, so that the amp and effects sound exactly as you have always imagined them. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is primarily due to the 2001 introduced VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to meet new sound requirements, which led to a performance boost of the VOX Valvetronix series in 2010 - with more dynamics as well as numerous and significantly improved amplifier models.From the handy VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series was also designed in such a way that all guitarists in search of maximum sound diversity will hit the jackpot. All guitarists dream of the compression and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, as well as prompt response. During an in-depth analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the final stage determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed based on this finding the VOX Valve Reactor technology.The valve reactor circuit of each VT+ amplifier, equipped with a 12AX7 tube, perfectly reproduces the behavior, subtle nuances, and sound character of a tube amplifier."

translation1: "Federal Minister Klara Geywitz: Expropriation does not create new housing The new Federal Minister Klara Geywitz (SPD) has spoken out against the expropriation of large housing corporations as demanded in a popular vote in Berlin. \"With expropriation, not a single new apartment is created, it only changes the ownership structure,\" said Geywitz in an interview with the \"Tagesspiegel\" (Sunday).My goal is to provide tenants with security that their rent will remain payable in the coming years. A colorful mix of private landlords, cooperatives, or housing companies is actually the best protection against monopolization. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens, and Left Party plans to set up an expert commission, as how to deal with the result of the referendum.However, if the situation does not calm down, Geywitz did not rule out talks with the FDP in the traffic light coalition about further tightening of the rental law. The coalition agreement provides for a rent brake until 2029, a limit on landlord increases in tight housing markets, and the expansion of the rent cap. I will speak with the Justice Minister to implement this as quickly as possible.If the rental market does not calm down, \"we will discuss further steps with our coalition partners,\" emphasized the SPD politician."

translation1: "I am bored with Sky Sport F1 Hello dear F1 fans, throughout the season, the quality on the German Sky has decreased so much that I need to vent a bit with this post. First of all, the transmission was interrupted during the F2 race to start the F1 coverage on time.Although the delayed start and the accident at the beginning put the schedule far behind schedule, it would still have been possible to show the last (planned) ten minutes as well as the championship decision (!) if necessary. However, it seems that for legal reasons, F1 has priority and everything else has to be restricted, so Sky DE probably had no choice. Nevertheless, it's still stupid, especially since Sky UK broadcast the race to the end.Nonetheless, a small compliment: commentator Olivier Zwartjes has accompanied the difficult situation around the serious accident well. Then there was again a rule misunderstanding among the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, as both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag in F1. Although this situation had already occurred in Imola, Baku, and Silverstone this year, both only came to the conclusion that Verstappen could change tires when there were relevant radio messages about this topic to Hamilton.At Sky UK and RTL, both commentators immediately knew that there was a possibility for Verstappen. I believe that one should simply know such elementary rules if they comment on the F1 on a pay-TV channel. It is also not the first riddle that is now possible or prescribed according to the rules. Both have constant uncertainties in the topic of rules.Generally, Roos' artificial commenting style doesn't appeal to me, but I have to admit that it's a matter of taste. However, I genuinely find Heiko Water from RTL better. There are constant nonsensical things that both come across as unprofessional, such as ordering coffee from the equally clueless reporter Peter Hardenacke or \"UuuuuHD\" from Ralf Schumacher.The latest commentator is causing a lot of commotion in the comments, which seems not to take him seriously. Not least, advertising takes over on Sky, while in the final stretch, Sky is the only channel that goes into advertising, as you can hear the German commentary without commentary after the race on F1TV. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this.Although these two channels show less advertising than Sky, and as free TV channels, I must say that Glock and Baumgartner deserve praise for their work. However, this does not allow me to overlook the disadvantages. The rest of the Sky Sports F1 program is also very sparse and full of repeats.Overall, Sky is really the worst German-speaking broadcaster to transmit the F1. Ironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they are still allowed to broadcast, excluding advertising. So, the fantastic F1 season makes significantly less fun than it would with a reasonable broadcaster.I would be interested in your opinion."

Moreover, some phrases such as 'a small compliment:' and 'I would be interested in your opinion' appear abruptly, making the flow of the text choppy. It is not the case that he should wind K2 and accompany them for hours while falling asleep. It is probably legally questionable.Perhaps the statement of the psychologist also applies here. translation1: "Heavy \"Helper\" question: Amberg knows the solution. What is a \"Helper\"? With this dialect word, sent by an Amberg resident, a heavy thought has been stirred up in the BR television show \"We in Bavaria\".However, unlike many previous days, the term \"Host mi?\" remained unrecognized by the callers this time. No, it was not a \"person who is nervous\". And neither was it someone who \"has to get everything done quickly\".As people heard from the TV presenter, it was completely wrong. The man from Amberg revealed the solution and thus probably caused amazement among many Upper Palatinate residents. \"The Huidlerer,\" the viewers learned, \"is a cloth used to wipe the stove.\"Dialectologist Antony Rowley, who has been consulted as an expert by Bavarian Television for many years, confirmed this. With the comment that this is a typical Upper Palatinate term, somehow derived from the more well-known dialect word \"Houdern\". With this, a gap in education was closed - perhaps also for many who have been living in the Amberg area for a long time."

translation1: "Friedrich wins 60th World Cup victory - Nolte wins in two-man bob - Sport The brand of the Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 achievements is the goal of the bobsled pilot. \"I have calculated it, I would have to drive nine and a half victories per season, then I could achieve it until Cortina 2026,\" said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who scored two successes in two days at the races in Winterberg.First, he defended against Johannes Lochner's attack on Saturday by reducing his lead by 0.5 seconds, going from rank three to one. Then he made a slight adjustment to his material setting and emerged with a larger lead of 0.30 seconds on Sunday. With his team consisting of Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg), and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he beat the Brit Brad Hall.Third was the Austrian Benjamin Maier. \"We went for a greater risk today and were rewarded,\" said Friedrich, who also brought in his 22nd consecutive win. The Berchtesgaden driver Johannes Lochner, who drives for Stuttgart, came in second this time in fifth place.Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach finished in fourth place in the first race and ended up in eighth place. \"If I knew what he was doing differently, I would also do it,\" said Lochner. Nolte wins at home - Jamanka on the podium  Translation:  Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach finished in fourth place in the first race and ended up in eighth place. \"If I knew what he was doing differently, I would also do it,\" said Lochner. Nolte wins at home - Jamanka on the podiumLaura Nolte scored her third season win in the two-man bob on her home track. After only reaching fourth place in the monobob the day before, she raced to a World Cup victory with her pusher Deborah Levi on Sunday. Two-man bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from the BRC Thüringen finished in second place with Germany's fastest sprinter, Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen.Besides qualifying for the Olympics, she achieved her first podium finish this winter. Wiesbaden's Kim Kalicki finished with Leonie Fiebig in third place. For me, it was really cool to achieve my first podium in the World Cup, and I'm super happy that Mariama is joining me.I am very happy with the development. There is still a lot of potential, but the start times today were okay, said Burghardt and emphasized: \"It's not just pushing, but there is also a lot to do around it.\" Jamanka was a bit annoyed by the not entirely flawless rides, but said: \"It's going in the right direction.\""
